ai-thag16.3:1.2_0: though I keenly contemplated the teaching,
ai-thag16.3:1.3_0: I gained no peace of mind.
ai-thag16.3:1.4_0: So I asked this of ascetics and brahmins:
ai-thag16.3:2.2_0: Whose attainment culminates in the deathless?
ai-thag16.3:4.1_0: Dragging it along, I’m not free
ai-thag16.3:4.3_0: Who will free me from bonds in the world,
ai-thag16.3:4.4_0: so that I may know awakening?
ai-thag16.3:5.4_0: to sweep away old age and death?
ai-thag16.3:6.1_0: Tied up with uncertainty and doubt,
ai-thag16.3:6.2_0: secured by the power of pride,
ai-thag16.3:6.3_0: rigid as a mind beset by anger;
ai-thag16.3:7.1_0: propelled by the bow of craving,
ai-thag16.3:7.2_0: is stuck in my twice-fifteen ribs—
ai-thag16.3:7.3_0: see how it stands in my breast,
ai-thag16.3:8.2_0: they are sharpened by memories and intentions;
ai-thag16.3:8.3_0: and pierced by this I tremble,
ai-thag16.3:8.4_0: like a leaf blowing in the wind.
ai-thag16.3:9.2_0: what belongs to me burns quickly,
ai-thag16.3:9.3_0: in that place where the body always heads
ai-thag16.3:9.4_0: with its six sense-fields of contact.
ai-thag16.3:10.2_0: who can pull out my dart of doubt
ai-thag16.3:11.2_0: who will pull out this dart
ai-thag16.3:11.4_0: without harming any part of my body?
ai-thag16.3:12.1_0: He really would be the Lord of the Dhamma,
ai-thag16.3:12.2_0: the best one to cure the damage of poison;
ai-thag16.3:12.3_0: when I have fallen into deep waters,
ai-thag16.3:12.4_0: he would give me his hand and bring me to the shore.
ai-thag16.3:13.2_0: and I can’t wash off the mud and dirt.
ai-thag16.3:13.3_0: It’s full of fraud, jealousy, pride,
ai-thag16.3:14.3_0: I’ll carry it to the body,
ai-thag16.3:14.4_0: that sweep off a person with bad views.
ai-thag16.3:15.1_0: At hearing, they’re freed in every respect
ai-thag16.3:15.2_0: a weed springs up and remains.
ai-thag16.3:16.4_0: cut you down suddenly like a tree.”
ai-thag16.3:17.1_0: That is how the teacher whose weapon is wisdom,
ai-thag16.3:17.2_0: surrounded by the Saṅgha of hermits,
ai-thag16.3:17.3_0: was my shelter when I was full of fear,
ai-thag16.3:17.4_0: seeking the far shore from the near.
ai-thag16.3:18.1_0: As I was being swept away,
ai-thag16.3:18.2_0: he gave me a strong, simple ladder,
ai-thag16.3:18.3_0: made of the heartwood of Dhamma,
ai-thag16.3:18.4_0: and he said to me: “Do not fear.”
ai-thag16.3:19.1_0: I climbed the tower of mindfulness meditation,
ai-thag16.3:19.3_0: Whatever I used to be your own,
ai-thag16.3:19.4_0: as I’d obsessed over in the past.
ai-thag16.3:20.2_0: as I was embarking on the ship,
ai-thag16.3:21.1_0: The dart that arises in oneself,
ai-thag16.3:21.2_0: and that which stems from attachment to rebirth:
ai-thag16.3:22.1_0: For a long time this misconception
ai-thag16.3:22.2_0: for a long time it was fixed in me:
